result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell T Picord was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence. STRAIGHT TIME.
**07-13-15/Order amending JOC commuting probation to one (1) year**

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, costs, fees, and assessments by the end of supervision period or any remaining balance shall convert to civil judgment. Provide DNA sample. Pay all supervision fees.

Obtain/maintain full time employment.
Seek vocational and/or educational training.

No illegal drugs or association with drug community (no place where drugs are possessed, used, or sold)- any violation shall result in condition time in HOC: 1st violation- 10 days, 2nd- 25 days, 3rd- 40 days, 4th- balance of condition time to be served. Upon 4th violation the court recommends revocation.
No contact with co-actor Jacob O. Leszczynski.

Participate in Cognitive Behavior Therapy program.
Draft and turn over to agent within 45 days a memorandum clearly and truthfully describing this incident- failure to do so shall result in lift of stay as to 9 months condition time.

Obtain AODA assessment and successfully complete follow up treatment.
Cooperate with random urine screens- agent to impose 10 days straight time for any/each positive test.

timeConds.notes:
** 10-26-15/ Ellen R Brostrom**
The Court imposed 10 days HOC as a sanction for the current violations.                

Straight time- STAYED for agent use to address probation violations.
Perform 25 hours of community service speaking to youth/churches regarding drug experience and death of friend.

Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy G. Dugan, Branch 10, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify probationary term.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Defendant Mitchell T Picord in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court ordered bench warrant issued and stayed on 5-8-2015 vacated.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 10.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Copy of letter from Gateway Alcohol & Drug Treatment.

Defendant Mitchell T Picord in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape#15-052

Due to the co-defendant case# 15CF000993 and at request of the State, defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 10.
